Luxeshop.title: Luxeshop E-commerce
Luxeshop.description: E-commerce site, possibility to register, to log in, to search for products, to add them to favorites and to buy them via a Stripe integration.
Luxeshop.context: Demonstration of my web development skills.
Luxeshop.fullDescription: This site was created to demonstrate my skills in web development. I chose to integrate a mockup found on Dribbble:link=https://dribbble.com/ and to make it fully functional.% The user can authenticate via a Google:link=https://www.google.com/ account, and this system was implemented using NextAuth:link=https://next-auth.js.org/ which manages authentication and sessions. On the homepage, users can find products currently on sale. If they wish, they can add them to their favorites.% They can also perform a search using a search bar to find a specific product. An extension of PostgreSQL:link=https://www.postgresql.org/ has been added to enable more efficient product searches.% The user can also add a product to their cart, remove it, or increase or decrease the quantity. Then, if they wish, they can proceed to checkout and place an order.% To do this, they must enter their shipping information through an interactive interface. Once that is done, they can pay for their order using a Stripe payment form:link=https://stripe.com/fr to secure payments.% If the order is confirmed, the user is redirected to an order confirmation page.

161.title: Clone of the company 161
161.description: Showcase site of the company 161, presentation of services, achievements and integration of the OpenStreetView map.
161.context: Demonstration of my web development skills.
161.fullDescription: This site was created to showcase my web development skills. I chose to create a clone of the website for the company 161:link=https://161.io/, which is based in Boves, Somme.% Notably, this is also the company where I completed my second-year internship for my IT degree. Many thanks to them for their trust, and especially to my internship supervisor, Mr. Asselin:link=https://www.linkedin.com/in/basselin/, who taught me a great deal.% On this site, users can explore the services offered by the company, the projects they’ve completed, and an OpenStreetMap:link=https://www.openstreetmap.org/ map to locate them.% I also used the Leaflet:link=https://leafletjs.com/ library to integrate the map and make it interactive. Users can zoom in, zoom out, and move around the map.

MusicPlayer.title: Music Player
MusicPlayer.description: Music player application, integrating the Spotify API. Possibility to authenticate via a Spotify account. Also, possibility to listen to favorite songs, playlists and albums. You can pause the music, skip it, restart it and change the volume.
MusicPlayer.context: Demonstration of my web development skills.
MusicPlayer.fullDescription: This website was created to showcase my web development skills. I chose to create a music player that integrates the Spotify:link=https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api. API. This project allowed me to explore this API and understand how it works.% To use the application, the user must authenticate via a Spotify account and launch the app on a Spotify-compatible device. The user can then listen to their favorite tracks, which I retrieve by making requests to the API. The user can play, pause, skip tracks, restart them, and adjust the volume.% Although this project is not yet complete, it has given me valuable experience in working with the Spotify:link=https://open.spotify.com/ API and a deeper understanding of its functionality.

CareerSection.title:
Discover my journey

in computer science!

TextReveal.1: At the *age of *thirteen, I *began *learning programming by *discovering the video game *Minecraft.% While *exploring its possibilities, I *realized that it was *possible to *create *servers to play with friends.% This is how *I *started *learning the *Java programming *language, initially in a *self-taught way, with little structure, but enough to *develop my first plugins.% Gradually, I refined *my *skills in this *language by *following *online *courses and adopting a more *rigorous approach.
TextReveal.2: *I had the opportunity to *collaborate with several major *French-speaking *Minecraft servers, which allowed me to develop over *7 years of experience in *development.% In *2020, I decided to create my *self-employed business and to launch myself as a *freelancer, thus continuing my journey.% Over the years, I have also turned to *web development, as you can discover on this *site.% Finally, I graduated with a *Bachelor’s degree in *Computer Science that I obtained from *UPJV *Amiens in 2024.
